sen.j: 松尾 卯一太（まつお ういった、1879年1月27日 - 1911年1月24日）は社会主義者。
sen.e: Uitta MATSUO (January 27, 1879 - January 24, 1911) is a known socialist.
Uitta MATSUO (January 27, 1879 - January 24, 1911) was a socialist.
sen.cmt: is→was としました。known を削除しました。
sen.e: Uitta MATSUO (January 27, 1879 - January 24, 1911) was a socialist.

sen.j: 幸徳事件で処刑された12名の1人。
sen.e: He is one of the 12 convicts of those who were executed for Kotoku Incident.
He is one of the 12 convicts of those who were executed for Kotoku Incident.
He is one of the 12 convicts of those who were executed for Kotoku Incident.
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
He was born in Kumamoto Prefecture.
He was born in Kumamoto Prefecture.
He was born in Kumamoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 熊本県立済々黌高等学校卒業。
sen.e: He graduated from Kumamoto Prefectural Seiseiko High School.
He graduated from Kumamoto Prefectural Seiseiko High School.
He graduated from Kumamoto Prefectural Seiseiko High School.

sen.j: 1907年新美卯一郎と『熊本評論』を創刊し、発行人兼編集人を務める（1908年9月20日廃刊）。
sen.e: He started publishing "Kumamoto Hyoron" ("Kumamoto Review") in 1907 with Uichiro NIIMI, as the publisher and the editor of the magazine.
He started publishing "Kumamoto Hyoron" (Kumamoto Review) in 1907 with Uichiro NIIMI, as the publisher and the editor of the newspaper (ceased publication on September 20, 1908).
sen.cmt: 括弧内の引用符を削除しました。『熊本評論』は、（雑誌としているサイトもありますが）新聞とする方が適当と思われますので修正しました。（http://www.library.pref.kumamoto.jp/kindai/kinbun-news23.pdf#search='熊本評論'）訳漏れ（1908年9月20日廃刊）対応しました。
sen.e: He started publishing "Kumamoto Hyoron" (Kumamoto Review) in 1907 with Uichiro NIIMI, as the publisher and the editor of the newspaper (ceased publication on September 20, 1908).

sen.j: 1909年上京し、『平民評論』を創刊するが発行禁止。
sen.e: In 1909, he moved to Tokyo and published "Heimin Hyoron," ("The Reviews of Commoners") but the magazine was placed under a ban.
In 1909, he moved to Tokyo and published "Heimin Hyoron" (The Reviews of Commoners), but the newspaper was placed under a ban.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の引用符を削除しました。コンマを移動しました。magazine→newspaper としました。（http://sinbun.ndl.go.jp/cgi-bin/outeturan/E_N_id_hyo.cgi?ID=011289）
sen.e: In 1909, he moved to Tokyo and published "Heimin Hyoron" (The Reviews of Commoners), but the newspaper was placed under a ban.

sen.j: 1910年の幸徳事件に連座し刑死。
sen.e: He was implicated in Kotoku Incident in 1910, and later he was executed.
He was implicated in Kotoku Incident in 1910, and later he was executed.
He was implicated in Kotoku Incident in 1910, and later he was executed.
His age at death was 31.
Died at the age of 31.
sen.cmt: 用語統一の表記に変更しました。
sen.e: Died at the age of 31.
